mainBoard.name: Island
mainBoard.originalText: ocT: Add oU to your mana pool.

mainBoard.flavorText: Jolrael's choice of homes was far better than her choice of allies.

foreignData.name: Unentdecktes Paradies
foreignData.text: {T}: Erhöhe Deinen Manavorrat um ein Mana einer beliebigen Farbe. Bringe das Unentdeckte Paradies zu Beginn Deiner nächsten Enttap-Phase auf die Hand seines Besitzers zurück.

mainBoard.name: Undiscovered Paradise
mainBoard.originalText: ocT: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool. At the beginning of your next untap phase, return Undiscovered Paradise to owner's hand.

rulings.text: It will return even if some effect prevents you from untapping it. The ability is not replacing the untapping of the land in any way.
Only returns to owner’s hand if it is still on the battlefield at the beginning of its controller’s next untap.

mainBoard.text: {T}: Add one mana of any color. During your next untap step, as you untap your permanents, return Undiscovered Paradise to its owner's hand.

mainBoard.flavorText: "The land promises nothing and keeps its promise." —Oracle en-Vec

foreignData.name: Einöde
foreignData.text:
{T}: Erhöhe Deinen Manavorrat um ein farbloses Mana.
{T}, opfere die Einöde: Zerstöre ein Nicht-Standardland Deiner Wahl.

mainBoard.name: Wasteland
mainBoard.originalText:
ocT: Add one colorless mana to your mana pool.
ocT, Sacrifice Wasteland: Destroy target nonbasic land.
mainBoard.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{T}, Sacrifice Wasteland: Destroy target nonbasic land.

mainBoard.flavorText: "Beauty to the eye does not always translate to the touch." —Naimah, Femeref philosopher

foreignData.name: Galeerenqualle
foreignData.text: Wenn die Galeerenqualle ins Spiel kommt, bringe eine Kreatur Deiner Wahl zurück auf die Hand ihres Besitzers.

mainBoard.name: Man-o'-War
mainBoard.originalText: When Man-o'-War comes into play, return target creature to owner's hand.

rulings.text: If there are no other creatures on the battlefield when Man-o’-War enters the battlefield, its ability must target itself.

mainBoard.text: When Man-o'-War enters the battlefield, return target creature to its owner's hand.

mainBoard.flavorText: "Comfortable even in a furnace? I've never met one who'd accept my wager." —Talibah, embermage

foreignData.name: Feuerwanderer der Suq'Ata
foreignData.text:
Der Feuerwanderer der Suq'Ata kann nicht das Ziel von roten Zaubersprüchen oder Effekten sein.
{T}: Der Feuerwanderer der Suq'Ata fügt einer Kreatur oder einem Spieler Deiner Wahl 1 Schadenspunkt zu.

mainBoard.name: Suq'Ata Firewalker
mainBoard.originalText:
Suq'Ata Firewalker cannot be the target of red spells or effects.
ocT: Suq'Ata Firewalker deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
mainBoard.text:
Suq'Ata Firewalker can't be the target of red spells or abilities from red sources.
{T}: Suq'Ata Firewalker deals 1 damage to any target.

mainBoard.flavorText: "In Barrin's name!" cried Lyna as Hanna's sword passed through her, "Ertai sends word that the portal is open—but not for long!"

foreignData.name: Flackerndes Portal
foreignData.text: 1, {T}: Bringe eine Kreatur Deiner Wahl auf die Hand ihres Besitzers zurück, wenn ihr Beherrscher nicht 1 bezahlt.

mainBoard.name: Erratic Portal
mainBoard.originalText: o1, ocT: Return target creature to owner's hand unless its controller pays o1.
mainBoard.text: {1}, {T}: Return target creature to its owner's hand unless its controller pays {1}.

mainBoard.flavorText: Throw stones, and throw away the world. —Dwarven proverb

foreignData.name: Fellwarstein
foreignData.text: {T}: Erhöhe Deinen Manavorrat um ein Mana eines Typs, den ein Land eines Gegners produzieren kann. Spiele diese Fähigkeit wie eine Manaquelle.

mainBoard.name: Fellwar Stone
mainBoard.originalText: ocT: Add to your mana pool one mana of any type that any opponent's lands can produce. Play this ability as a mana source.

rulings.text: This works even if the opponent’s lands are tapped. It only checks what kinds of mana can be produced, not if the abilities that produce them are usable right now.
The ability can be activated if the opponent has no lands that produce mana, but the effect will not be able to generate any mana.
It only produces one mana even if the land can produce more than one.
The colors of mana are white, blue, black, red, and green. Fellwar Stone can’t be tapped for colorless mana, even if a land an opponent controls could produce colorless mana.

Fellwar Stone checks the effects of all mana-producing abilities of lands your opponents control, but it doesn’t check their costs. For example, Vivid Crag has the ability “{T}, Remove a charge counter from Vivid Crag: Add one mana of any color.” If an opponent controls Vivid Crag and you control Fellwar Stone, you can tap Fellwar Stone for any color of mana. It doesn’t matter whether Vivid Crag has a charge counter on it, and it doesn’t matter whether it’s untapped.

When determining what colors of mana your opponents’ lands could produce, take into account any applicable replacement effects that would apply to those lands’ mana abilities (such as Contamination’s effect, for example). If there is more than one, consider them in any possible order.

Fellwar Stone doesn’t care about any restrictions or riders your opponents’ lands (such as Ancient Ziggurat or Hall of the Bandit Lord) put on the mana they produce. It just cares about colors of mana.

mainBoard.text: {T}: Add one mana of any color that a land an opponent controls could produce.

mainBoard.flavorText: "When once winter has ahold, Not willingly does she withdraw her icy touch, wistfully caressing— The deepened air sleeps its cold." —Aline Corralurn, "Late Thaw"

foreignData.name: Frostbringer
foreignData.text: Spieler können während ihrer Enttap-Phase nicht mehr als ein Land enttappen.

mainBoard.name: Winter Orb
mainBoard.originalText: Players cannot untap more than one land during their untap phases.

rulings.text: All permanents untap during a player’s untap step at once. If Winter Orb is tapped as your untap step begins, your lands will all untap.
You can’t tap Winter Orb just because you want to. Another ability, such as that of Glare of Subdual, must instruct or allow you to do so.

mainBoard.text: As long as Winter Orb is untapped, players can't untap more than one land during their untap steps.

foreignData.name: Verführerisches Vermächtnis
foreignData.text:
Du kannst während Deiner Versorgungsphase eine Schatzmarke auf das Verführerische Vermächtnis.
Opfere das Verführerische Vermächtnis: Übernimm die Kontrolle über eine Kreatur Deiner Wahl, deren Stärke nicht größer als die Anzahl der Schatzmarken auf dem Verführerischen Vermächtnis ist.

mainBoard.name: Legacy's Allure
mainBoard.originalText:
During your upkeep, you may put a treasure counter on Legacy's Allure.
Sacrifice Legacy's Allure: Permanently gain control of target creature with power no greater than the number of treasure counters on Legacy's Allure.

rulings.text: The “power less than or equal to the number of treasure counters on this card” restriction is a targeting restriction and will be checked on resolution in addition to on announcement. If the creature’s power changes to be greater than this before the effect resolves, then the Legacy’s Allure triggered ability doesn’t resolve, but the card stays in the graveyard.

mainBoard.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a treasure counter on Legacy's Allure.
Sacrifice Legacy's Allure: Gain control of target creature with power less than or equal to the number of treasure counters on Legacy's Allure. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

mainBoard.flavorText: "You've failed Gerrard. You've failed the Legacy. You've failed yourself. I can do no more." —Volrath, to Karn

foreignData.name: Propaganda
foreignData.text: Kreaturen können nicht angreifen, wenn ihr Beherrscher nicht zusätzlich {2} für diese Kreatur bezahlt.

mainBoard.name: Propaganda
mainBoard.originalText: Each turn, each creature cannot attack you unless its controller pays an additional o2 for that creature.

rulings.text: The payment is made during the declare attackers step at the same time you are declaring the attacker.
If there is more than one Propaganda on the battlefield, the cost is cumulative.
If there are multiple attacks in a turn, then you have to pay for each attack.
Paying this cost is not an instant or any other kind of ability, it is an additional cost on the declaration of the attacker.
In the Two-Headed Giant format, you still only have to pay once per creature.
Unless some effect explicitly says otherwise, a creature that can’t attack you can still attack a planeswalker you control.

mainBoard.text: Creatures can't attack you unless their controller pays {2} for each creature they control that's attacking you.

foreignData.name: Kentern
foreignData.text:
Rückkauf 3
Bringe eine bleibende Karte Deiner Wahl zurück auf die Hand ihres Besitzers.

mainBoard.name: Capsize
mainBoard.originalText:
Buyback o3 (You may pay an additional o3 when you play this spell. If you do, put it into your hand instead of your graveyard as part of the spell's effect.)
Return target permanent to owner's hand.
mainBoard.text:
Buyback {3} (You may pay an additional {3} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Return target permanent to its owner's hand.

mainBoard.flavorText: "It was probably a lousy spell in the first place." —Ertai, wizard adept

foreignData.name: Gegenzauber
foreignData.text: Neutralisiere einen Zauberspruch Deiner Wahl.

mainBoard.name: Counterspell

mainBoard.flavorText: "Unknown spears / Suddenly hurtle before my dream-awakened eyes . . . ." —William Butler Yeats, "The Valley of the Black Pig"

foreignData.text: Neutralisiere einen Zauberspruch Deiner Wahl, wenn dessen Urheber nicht zusätzlich 1 bezahlt.

mainBoard.name: Force Spike
mainBoard.originalText: Counter target spell unless its caster pays an additional o1.

rulings.text: The payment is optional.

mainBoard.text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1}.

mainBoard.flavorText: "Controlling time ensures you need never look impulsive again." —Teferi

foreignData.name: Impuls
foreignData.text: Schaue Dir die obersten vier Karten Deiner Bibliothek an. Nimm eine davon auf deine Hand und lege die übrigen unter deine Bibliothek.

mainBoard.name: Impulse
mainBoard.originalText: Look at the top four cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library. Shuffle your library afterwards.

rulings.text: This is not a draw.
Due to errata, you no longer shuffle your library.

mainBoard.text: Look at the top four cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

mainBoard.flavorText: "The fatal flaw in every plan is the assumption that you know more than your enemy." —Volrath

foreignData.name: Manaleck
foreignData.text: Neutralisiere einen Zauberspruch Deiner Wahl, wenn dessen Urheber nicht zusätzlich 3 ausgibt.

mainBoard.name: Mana Leak
mainBoard.originalText: Counter target spell unless its caster pays an additional o3.
mainBoard.text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {3}.

mainBoard.flavorText: "Oh, I had a conscience once. But alas, I seem to have forgotten where I put it." —Chandler

foreignData.name: Gedächtnislücke
foreignData.text: Neutralisiere einen Zauberspruch Deiner Wahl. Lege diesen Spruch oben auf die Bibliothek seines Besitzers.

mainBoard.name: Memory Lapse
mainBoard.originalText: Counter target spell. Put that spell on top of owner's library.

rulings.text: Memory Lapse has a self-replacement effect that replaces the spell going to the graveyard before any other effect can replace that event. If the spell was cast using flashback, however, flashback will change the spell’s destination from its owner’s library to exile.

mainBoard.text: Counter target spell. If that spell is countered this way, put it on top of its owner's library instead of into that player's graveyard.

foreignData.name: Gedankentrick
foreignData.text:
Rückkauf 2U
Tappe ein Artefakt, eine Kreatur oder ein Land Deiner Wahl.

mainBoard.name: Mind Games
mainBoard.originalText:
Buyback o2oU (You may pay an additional o2oU when you play this spell. If you do, put it into your hand instead of your graveyard as part of the spell's effect.)
Tap target artifact, creature, or land.
mainBoard.text:
Buyback {2}{U} (You may pay an additional {2}{U} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Tap target artifact, creature, or land.

foreignData.name: Kraftverlust
foreignData.text: Neutralisiere einen Zauberspruch Deiner Wahl, wenn dessen Urheber nicht sofort X ausgibt. Wenn er dies nicht tut, tappe alle manaproduzierenden Länder, die dieser Spieler kontrolliert und entleere seinen Manavorrat.

mainBoard.name: Power Sink
mainBoard.originalText: Counter target spell unless its caster pays an additional oX. If he or she does not, tap all mana-producing lands that player controls and remove all mana from his or her mana pool.

rulings.text: Does not increase the mana cost of the spell. It just requires a separate expenditure in order for it to succeed.

When this spell resolves, you either pay X mana or let your lands become tapped. The lands that become tapped are not “tapped for mana”. If you choose to pay, you may pay the X mana using whatever mana abilities you want to use.

Only lands that actually have mana abilities will get tapped. This includes basic lands and lands with mana abilities printed on them, as well as lands which have been granted a mana ability by some effect.

mainBoard.text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {X}. If that player doesn't, they tap all lands with mana abilities they control and lose all unspent mana.

sideBoard.flavorText: "Heed the lessons of our time: the forms of water may move the land itself and hold captive the fires within." —Gustha Ebbasdotter, Kjeldoran royal mage

foreignData.name: Hydroknall
foreignData.text:
Neutralisiere einen Zauberspruch Deiner Wahl, wenn er rot ist, oder zerstöre eine bleibende Karte Deiner Wahl, wenn sie rot ist.
Spiele diesen Zauberspruch als Spontanzauber, wenn er auf eine bleibende Karte zielt.

sideBoard.name: Hydroblast
sideBoard.originalText: Counter target spell if it is red, or destroy target permanent if it is red. (If this spell targets a permanent, play it as an instant.)

rulings.text: The decision to counter a spell or destroy a permanent is a decision made on announcement before the target is selected. If the spell is redirected, this mode can’t be changed, so only targets of the selected type are valid.
Hydroblast can target any spell or permanent, not just a red one. It checks the color of the target only on resolution.

sideBoard.text:
Choose one —
• Counter target spell if it's red.
• Destroy target permanent if it's red.

foreignData.name: Abkühlung
foreignData.text: Rote Zaubersprüche kosten zusätzlich 2.

sideBoard.name: Chill
sideBoard.originalText: Red spells cost an additional o2 to play.
sideBoard.text: Red spells cost {2} more to cast.

sideBoard.flavorText: This spell, like many attributed to Drafna, was actually the work of his wife and former student, Hurkyl.

foreignData.name: Hurkyls Erinnerung
foreignData.text: Bringe alle Artefakte im Spiel, die ein Spieler Deiner Wahl besitzt, auf seine Hand zurück.

sideBoard.name: Hurkyl's Recall
sideBoard.originalText: Return to target player's hand all artifacts in play he or she owns.

rulings.text: Retrieves all artifacts owned by the target player regardless of who controls them. Ignores artifacts owned by other players even if target player has control of them.
It only returns artifacts which are on the battlefield.

sideBoard.text: Return all artifacts target player owns to their hand.

sideBoard.flavorText: "O! call back yesterday, bid time return." —William Shakespeare, King Richard the Second

foreignData.text: Bringe eine bleibende Karte Deiner Wahl zurück auf die Hand ihres Besitzers.

sideBoard.text: Return target permanent to its owner's hand.

rulings.text: The payment is made during the declare attackers step at the same time you are declaring the attacker.
If there is more than one Propaganda on the battlefield, the cost is cumulative.

foreignData.name: Zurs bizarre Welt
foreignData.text:
Alle Spieler spielen ab jetzt mit offenen Karten.
Immer wenn ein Spieler eine Karte zieht, kann ein anderer Spieler 2 Lebenspunkte bezahlen, damit dieser Spieler die Karte abwerfen muß.

sideBoard.name: Zur's Weirding
sideBoard.originalText:
Players play with their hands face up.
Whenever any player draws a card, any other player may pay 2 life to force the drawing player to discard that card.

rulings.text: If someone pays the cost, then the card was never drawn or discarded. It just gets put into the graveyard directly from the library.
This is a continuous replacement effect that modifies a draw.
If a spell or ability causes more than one card to be drawn, draw the cards one at a time and deal with this replacement before drawing the next card.

When using Dredge with this, you have two choices. You can immediately replace the draw with Dredge, or you can apply Zur’s Weirding’s replacement. If the latter, you first resolve Zur’s Weirding’s ability, then if you’re going to draw the card, decide whether or not to replace that draw with Dredge.

sideBoard.text:
Players play with their hands revealed.
If a player would draw a card, they reveal it instead. Then any other player may pay 2 life. If a player does, put that card into its owner's graveyard. Otherwise, that player draws a card.

foreignData.name: Phyrexianischer Ofen
foreignData.text:
{T}: Entferne die unterste Karte aus dem Friedhof eines Spielers Deiner Wahl ganz aus dem Spiel.
1, opfere den Phyrexianischen Ofen: Entferne eine Karte Deiner Wahl aus irgendeinem Friedhof ganz aus dem Spiel und ziehe eine Karte.

sideBoard.name: Phyrexian Furnace
sideBoard.originalText:
ocT: Remove the bottom card of target player's graveyard from the game.
o1, Sacrifice Phyrexian Furnace: Remove target card in any graveyard from the game and draw a card.
sideBoard.text:
{T}: Exile the bottom card of target player's graveyard.
{1}, Sacrifice Phyrexian Furnace: Exile target card from a graveyard. Draw a card.

sideBoard.flavorText: "In Barrin's name!" cried Lyna as Hanna's sword passed through her, "Ertai sends word that the portal is open—but not for long!"

foreignData.name: Flackerndes Portal
foreignData.text: 1, {T}: Bringe eine Kreatur Deiner Wahl auf die Hand ihres Besitzers zurück, wenn ihr Beherrscher nicht 1 bezahlt.

sideBoard.name: Erratic Portal
sideBoard.originalText: o1, ocT: Return target creature to owner's hand unless its controller pays o1.
sideBoard.text: {1}, {T}: Return target creature to its owner's hand unless its controller pays {1}.

foreignData.name: Fallgitter
foreignData.text: Immer wenn eine Kreatur ins Spiel kommt und zwei oder mehr andere Kreaturen im Spiel sind, lege diese Kreatur zur Seite. Wenn das Fallgitter das Spiel verlässt, bringe die Kreatur unter der Kontrolle ihres Besitzers ins Spiel.

sideBoard.name: Portcullis
sideBoard.originalText: Whenever any creature comes into play, if there are two or more other creatures in play, set that creature aside. If Portcullis leaves play, put the creature into play under its owner's control.

rulings.text: Creatures which are phasing in will not trigger this card’s ability.
If the creature that triggered Portcullis is no longer on the battlefield when the ability resolves, then it fails to do anything.
You check the count of the number of creatures on the battlefield again during resolution. The creature will not be exiled if the count is 2 or less.

The creature does enter the battlefield, so any other abilities that trigger on it entering the battlefield trigger. This follows the normal rules for timing triggered abilities: first, the current player puts their abilities on the stack in any order, then each other player in turn order does the same. Portcullis’ own ability is included in this, so it could result in the creature being exiled after some abilities have resolved, but before others.

The “when Portcullis leaves the battlefield” ability is set up as part of the ability that exiles the creature. It will trigger when Portcullis leaves the battlefield even if Portcullis has somehow lost its abilities at that time.

sideBoard.text: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield, if there are two or more other creatures on the battlefield, exile that creature. Return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control when Portcullis leaves the battlefield.
